enum.name: ASV_TABLE_REQUEST_ACK
enum.description: ACK / NACK / ERROR values as a result of ASV_TABLE_*_REQUEST commands.

entry.name: ASV_TABLE_DATA_FORMAT_RANGE_FLOAT_8BIT
entry.description: Write a value as a fraction between a given minimum and maximum. Uses 8 bits so we have '256' steps between min and max.

entry.name: ASV_TABLE_DATA_FORMAT_RANGE_FLOAT_16BIT
entry.description: Write a value as a fraction between a given minimum and maximum. Uses 16 bits so we have '65535' steps between min and max.

entry.name: ASV_TABLE_DATA_FORMAT_FLOAT
entry.description: Write a value as a float. Uses 32 bits.

message.name: ASV_TABLE_INFO_REQUEST
message.description: Requests available charts for visualization. Returns ASV_TABLE_INFO_RESPONSE and then items with ASV_TABLE_INFO. [!WRAP_TO_V2_EXTENSION_PACKET!]
message.field: Specifies a unique number for this request. This allows the response packet to be identified.
Specifies the start index of the records to be sent in the response.
Specifies the number of records to be sent in the response after the skip index.

message.name: ASV_TABLE_INFO_RESPONSE
message.description: Responds to the request for available charts for visualization. [!WRAP_TO_V2_EXTENSION_PACKET!]
message.field: Specifies the unique number of the original request. This allows the response to be matched to the correct request.
Number of ASV_TABLE_INFO items to be transmitted after this response with a success result code (dependent on the request).

message.name: ASV_TABLE_INFO_UPDATED_EVENT
message.description: Event about chart collection or it's element changed. [!WRAP_TO_V2_EXTENSION_PACKET!]
message.field: Number of ASV_TABLE_INFO items to be transmitted after this response with a success result code (dependent on the request).

message.name: ASV_TABLE_INFO
message.field: Chart name, terminated by NULL if the length is less than 16 human-readable chars, and WITHOUT null termination (NULL) byte if the length is exactly 16 chars. Applications have to provide 8+1 bytes storage if the ID is stored as a string.

Axis X name, terminated by NULL if the length is less than 16 human-readable chars, and WITHOUT null termination (NULL) byte if the length is exactly 16 chars. Applications have to provide 8+1 bytes storage if the ID is stored as a string.
Total measure points for Axis X. Dependent on chart type (1 measure for simple plot signal, more for heatmap signal).

Axis Y name, terminated by NULL if the length is less than 16 human-readable chars, and WITHOUT null termination (NULL) byte if the length is exactly 16 chars. Applications have to provide 8+1 bytes storage if the ID is stored as a string.
Total measure points for Axis Y.

message.name: ASV_TABLE_DATA_REQUEST
message.field: The ID of the requested chart
Hash of the chart ASV_TABLE_INFO to ensure that all settings are synchronized.
The requested message rate (delay in ms)

message.name: ASV_TABLE_DATA_RESPONSE
message.field: The ID of the requested chart
Hash of the chart ASV_TABLE_INFO to ensure that all settings are synchronized.
The requested message rate (delay in ms).

message.name: ASV_TABLE_DATA
message.field: Hash of the chart ASV_TABLE_INFO to ensure that all settings are synchronized.
Timestamp (UNIX epoch time) for current set of measures.
Number of packets for one frame.
Packet sequence number (starting with 0 on every encoded frame).
